question_text: A 64-year-old man with right upper lung squamous carcinoma is hospitalized for acute on chronic hypoxemic respiratory failure.Physical examination findings of the hand are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This patient has digital clubbing (Option A), which is the most common manifestation of hypertrophic osteoarthropathy. It is characterized by increased fingertip mass and nail plate curvature. Digital clubbing can be acquired or hereditary. Acquired bilateral clubbing is often associated with pulmonary or cardiovascular diseases, including lung cancer, COPD, and interstitial lung disease.In contrast, onycholysis is defined as distal separation of the nail plate from the underlying nail bed. It is usually associated with trauma, psoriasis, contact dermatitis, and certain medications. Onychomycosis is a fungal infection of the nail unit and is characterized by nail thickening and discoloration.
